Instructions to fill the Adverse Event/Product Complaint Reporting Form

Dear Consumer/Healthcare professional,

You have been provided here with instructions to fill all the sections of the form. Apart from this, there is a ready access to
specific instructions in different sections of the form when you fill the form online. It is compulsory to fill all the information
marked with an asterix (*).

Reporter’s Details

Name:

Please provide your name since you are reporting the event.

Occupation:

Please mention if you are a doctor, a nurse, a pharmacist etc., and your area of specialization.

Address:

Provide a complete and accurate address. Contact numbers are essential in case we need to reach you for more information.

Patient Information

Name or Initials:

Enter the accurate name or initials. This is essential to facilitate identification and locate the patient if needed.

Age or Date of Birth:

Provide the most accurate information available. Enter the date of birth, if known or the age in years.

Gender:

Select appropriate option of gender.

Weight:

Weight is to be entered.

Height:

Height is to be entered.

Address:

Complete and accurate address and contact numbers are essential in case we need to contact the patient for more information.

Suspect Products’ Information

You can provide information on more than one suspect product, but one of them should essentially be a Biocon product.

Please provide accurate names of the suspected medicinal product (brand name and generic name), the dosage form it is available in for use (tablet/injection/liquid/syrup/solution etc.), and strength in mg or mg/ml or as appropriate (example 500mg or 25 mg/ml).

Provide accurate lot number / batch number, and manufacturing, and expiry dates.

Check the box provided for ‘Yes’ if you have sent the sample of the product to Biocon for further investigations/evaluation. Mention the date the sample was sente.

If the accurate dates of use are not known, please provide the approximate duration of use in hours/days/weeks/months or years.

The medical condition (indication) for which the drug was given when the event occurred should be provided.

Product-related problem

Provide the reason for lodging this product complaint by checking the appropriate box: if the product was unstable when in use (i.e. if there was a change in color or sedimentation seen), if it was contaminated or was a counterfeit product, if the product didn’t work, if there was product confusion (by name, the labeling, design or packaging), if there were labeling problems caused by printing errors or omissions. If there is any other complaint, please give details in the space provided.

Only one adverse event/side effect should be reported in one form. If you want to report more than one adverse event/side effects, then use another form.

Indicate if the event you are going to report is an adverse event/a side effect or a product complaint or any other issue  such as product use error.

Adverse Event/Side Effect Information

Enter the date and time of the onset of the adverse event/side effect, date and time of the end of adverse event (if the adverse event has stopped). If accurate dates are not known, please provide the approximate duration of the event.

Event Description or product complaint description

If you are lodging a product complaint, provide the details here.

Indicate clearly the name of the adverse event or diagnosis of the event (if you are a healthcare professional).

Describe what happened in detail and give a summary of the relevant clinical information.

It is mandatory to provide the results of relevant tests and laboratory data.

Provide all appropriate information, including relevant negative test and laboratory findings in order to comprehensively convey how the medical work-up/assessment led to a strong consideration of the medical-product-induced adverse event. If applicable, include pre- and post-event medication levels and dates (optional), Synopsis of relevant autopsy, pathology or lab reports. Copies of reports may be submitted as attachments, with all confidential information deleted.

You can upload the related reports of lab investigations and physicians notes with the online reporting form.

Make it a point to include:

All medications that were used to treat the adverse event (name of the medicinal product, generic name, indication, route of administration, dose and frequency). Also provide information on whether the treatment medication and procedures are continuing or not.

Details of concomitant medications used, along with the suspect product and relevant information on the condition for which the concomitant medications were given.

Severity And Causality

If you consider the adverse event/side effect or product complaint to be serious, please mark YES. Refer to the following information for clarifying the reason why you consider the event to be serious. This should be filled if the physician is reporting the event.

 

Death:

Check if the patient has died.

Life-threatening:

If you suspect the patient was at risk of dying at the time of the event. It does not refer to an event that hypothetically might have caused death if it was more severe.

Hospitalization (initial or prolonged):

Check if admission to hospital or prolongation of hospitalization was a result of the adverse event.

DO check if:

A patient was admitted to hospital for only one day, even if the patient was discharged the same day.

A visit to the emergency room/ casualty, which may or may not have resulted in admission to hospital.

Persistent / Significant Disability:

Check if the adverse event resulted in substantial disruption of a person’s ability to perform normal life functions.

Congenital Anomaly/ Birth Defect:

Check if exposure to a product prior to conception or during pregnancy may have resulted in an adverse outcome in the child.

Other medically significant conditions:

Check if the event may require medical or surgical intervention to prevent one or the other outcomes. Examples include bronchospasm requiring emergency treatment, convulsions that do not result in hospitalization, or  the development of drug dependency or drug abuse.

Causality assessment criteria:

Causality assessment will be made by healthcare professionals, who will classify their assessment based on the  following criteria:

Certain:

Event or laboratory test abnormality, with plausible time relationship to drug intake, cannot be explained by disease or other drugs.

Response to withdrawal plausible (pharmacologically, pathologically).

Event definitive pharmacologically or phenomenologically (i.e. an objective and specific medical disorder or a recognized pharmacological phenomenon).

Rechallenge satisfactory, if necessary.

Probable / Likely:

Event or laboratory test abnormality, with reasonable time relationship to drug intake, unlikely to be attributed to disease or other drugs.

Response to withdrawal clinically reasonable.

Rechallenge not required.

Possible:

Event or laboratory test abnormality, with reasonable time relationship to drug intake, could also be explained by a disease or other drugs.

Information on drug withdrawal may be lacking or unclear

Unlikely

Event or laboratory test abnormality, with an improbable (but not impossible) time relationship to drug intake  could be explained by a disease or other drugs.

Conditional / Unclassified

Event or laboratory test abnormality.

More data for proper assessment needed, or additional data under examination.

Unassessable /Unclassifiable

Report suggesting an adverse reaction.

Cannot be judged because information is insufficient or contradictory.

Data cannot be supplemented or verified.

 

Outcome of the event

Check the appropriate block to indicate the outcome of the event -- if the person has recovered completely, not recovered, recovered with sequelae or if the event was fatal. Provide dates whereever they need to be filled in the form.

If the information for all of the above is not available, check in the block for Unknown.

Check the appropriate block to indicate if the event appeared again after stopping the therapy or after rechallenge of the drug.

If it has reappeared, specify how long the treatment lasted until reappearance.

Use the field provided for giving the rationale for relationship of the SAE to the study drug. This is to be filled by the healthcare professional.

DISCLAIMER

Biocon Biologics is committed to holding patient’s and reporter’s personal data in strict confidence. Personal data, here, means any information by which a person is, directly or indirectly, identified or identifiable, which includes, but is not limited, to name, address, contact number, email address, genetic data and data concerning health. Biocon Biologics strictly adheres to applicable data privacy and data integrity laws, including, but not limited to, General Data Protection Regulations [EU] 2016/679 [“GDPR”] or its equivalent, as amended from time to time.
